{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34816].
  {panel}

I’ve seen this recently with Confluence:
 
1. Authenticate to confluence
2. View/edit docs or whatever
3. Don’t use confluence for a while so that your session times out
4. Try to search for  something with the timed out session.  You will get prompted for your username/password
5. Once authenticated, the search string you entered is ignored and 114, 976 results are returned.
 
Either confluence should honor the search entered, or just take you to your home space, and not return a list of all the docs in confluence.
fields.summary: Searching lost when confluence session has timed out

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34814].
  {panel}

Currently user can only configure page in the same space as their home page.

The user should be allow to configure pages from a different spaces their homepage. This feature will be useful if the customer who want the same home spaces for all their spaces. With this feature, they do not need to copy the content of a pages to all their spaces.


Here's an example of a scenario on how this feature work:
# There are three  spaces A , B and C
# There is a page  P1 from space A
#  There should be a feature to allow the P1 to be configure as home page for  Space A , B and C.
fields.summary: Ability to configure same home page for different space.

h4. Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a User in Confluence with Following Details:
|Username|a|
|Full Name|A B|

2. Use {{@mention}} to tag user _a_ with the username.

h4. Actual Result:

It's not possible to use @mention to search for this user.

h4. Expected Result:

Username must be appear on the list of suggestions.

h4. Improvement Request:

It'd be good to allow users with one letter in first name, last name and username to use @mention functionality. At the meantime only users with the more than one letter in username or users with more than one letters in their name can be use this feature.

fields.description:
When using the Windows installer, a service is created. This service using the incorrect JVM arguments. When Confluence attempts to set up the database as part of the installation, it throws OutOfMemoryErrors as it runs out of PermGen space:

{code} -- referer: http://localhost:8090/setup/setupstandarddb-start.action?database=mssql | url: /setup/setupstandarddb.action | userName: anonymous | action: setupstandarddb
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: PermGen space
{code}

h3. Workaround (follow step by step instructions)

# Use https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Fix+Out+of+Memory+Errors+by+Increasing+Available+Memory#HowtoFixOutofMemoryErrorsbyIncreasingAvailableMemory-SettingPropertiesforWindowsServicesviatheWindowsRegistry to set properties for Windows service via the Windows Registry.
# Modify Parameters/Java/JvmMS to 400 in hexadecimal (1024 in decimal)
# Modify Parameters/Java/JvmMx to 400 in hexadecimal (1024 in decimal)
# Modify Parameters/Java/Options and add {{-XX:MaxPermSize=256m}} as the first line.
# Restart Confluence
fields.summary: Confluence runs out of PermGen space when installing on Windows

fields.description:
In Confluence's setenv.bat file:
{code}set CATALINA_OPTS=%CATALINA_OPTS% -Xms1024m -Xmx1024m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -XX:+UseG1GC
set CATALINA_OPTS=%CATALINA_OPTS% -Djava.awt.headless=true
set CATALINA_OPTS=%CATALINA_OPTS% -Xloggc:"%atlassian_logsdir%\gc-%atlassian_timestamp%.log"
set CATALINA_OPTS=%CATALINA_OPTS% -XX:+UseGCLogFileRotation -XX:NumberOfGCLogFiles=5 -XX:GCLogFileSize=2M
set CATALINA_OPTS=%CATALINA_OPTS% -XX:-PrintGCDetails -XX:+PrintGCTimeStamps -XX:-PrintTenuringDistribution
{code}

In a 5.6.1 instance that was running as a service created by the installer:

{code}jvmInputArguments = -Dcatalina.base=C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Confluence -Dcatalina.home=C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Confluence -Djava.endorsed.dirs=C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Confluence\endorsed -Djava.io.tmpdir=C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Confluence\temp -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManager -Djava.util.logging.config.file=C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Confluence\conf\logging.properties exit -Xms256m -Xmx512m {code}
fields.summary: The Confluence Windows installer creates a service with incorrect JVM arguments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34803].
  {panel}

After recent discussions with a couple of Atlassian's (at the Sydney AUG) and the maturity of the ASM for Atlassian install and upgrade script (https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.stuartryan.atlassian.asm) I am now looking towards the future to further be able to streamline the process for new installations of the Atlassian Suite (for new users).

Essentially what I am thinking of (long term.. i.e. endgame) is "Here Be Dragons", done with XML config files that can simply be submitted with a POST rather than going through web GUI configuration screens.

The first part of this that I would like to tackle is for Confluence, and allowing essentially a kickstart file to be submitted via a HTTP web service (for example) to auto configure the installation.

Essentially this should allow the pre-configuration of all the parameters that would normally be done via the web wizard GUI and allow far better automation of installs.

This should include:
* Database configuration details
* Backup restore details (if any)
* Hostname, Instance Name etc
* Administrator main details 
* Most importantly CROWD configuration details to hook directly into a pre-configured crowd instance.

The end goal for this would be to
1. Provide example kickstarts to get new users up and running more quickly on starter licenses
2. Provide the ability to spin up development/DR environments on demand (by pointing to restore files etc as part of the kickstart).
3. Decrease the time it takes to prepare a new installation and make "Here be Dragons" an easier quest for all future questorians.
fields.summary: Confluence Install Wizard - Allow a kickstart file to configure rather than wizard

fields.description:
Drafts are supposed to be per user and private but given a draft id, which should be easy to guess as they are sequential, you can access the contents of any draft, both for new and existing pages by using the following urls:

https://pug.jira.com/wiki/pages/createpage.action?useDraft=true&spaceKey=SPACE&draftId=target

https://pug.jira.com/wiki/pages/editpage.action?useDraft=true&spaceKey=SPACE&pageId=anyPageWithAccess&draftId=target

It seems that anonymous users cannot take advantage of this though, as drafts for them are queried in the session and not in the database.

Checked on PUG, but probably affects much older versions
fields.summary: Draft retrieval in the editor doesn't respect page or space permissions

fields.description:
I am coding a Confluence macro for which I have overriden the default macro editor dialog to get my own. I have a single string parameter in which I would like to store a JSON structure so I can easily parse it when the macro is edited again.

When doing so, after saving the macro, the macro element on the page editor does not behave properly. It should display the name of the Macro along with the parameters if I wish to display them. Instead the name is replaced with the first element of my JSON object and the parameter part is the rest of the JSON object (see attached image). Is there any trick besides changing my storage format and parsing by hand ?

When I edit the macro again, I do receive the data correctly. It is only a display problem in the Page Editor.

Here is my macro definition
{code}
<xhtml-macro name="canalmetadata" label="Canal Metadata"
               class="com.confluence.plugins.metadata.macros.CanalMetadataMacro"
               key="canal-metadata.macro">
    <description key="canal-metadata-macro.description">The metadata selection macro</description>
    <category name="confluence-content"/>
    <parameters>
        <parameter name="metaselection" type="string" required="true">
            <option key="showNameInPlaceholder" value="false"/>
            <option key="showValueInPlaceholder" value="false"/>
        </parameter>
    </parameters>
  </xhtml-macro>
{code}

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Add _Column_ macro to a page
# Set _Column width_ parameter to "{test"

Expected behaviour: Macro element in the page editor should have title "Column | width = {test".
Actual behaviour: Macro element in the page editor has title "test".
fields.summary: Macro parameter with open brace ({) character messes the Macro element in the page editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34793].
  {panel}

h3. Note

This error message is the catch-all exception for the JIRA Issues Macro, so there are a number of possible causes for this. The below example is one way of triggering the problem. Another known cause is the response from JIRA taking too long and exceeding the timeouts in Confluence. If you suspect this is the case in your instance, please refer to [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Timeouts+in+the+JIRA+Issues+Macro+or+Highlighting+Plugin] for more information.

If you run into this problem, please add the following packages to *Confluence Admin > Logging and Profiling* and set them to DEBUG level logging:
* com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira
* com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.JIRA

Having done so, please create a ticket at http://support.atlassian.com/ and attach a Support Zip with this extra logging. 

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Add many JIRA issue links on a Confluence page. Try 30.
# Save the page

h3. Expected Results

The JIRA issue links display fine with summary, status, etc.

h3. Actual Results

Confluence displays an error message for each JIRA issue link:

bq. JIRA Issues Macro: Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error

h3. More info

Confluence logs show:

{code}
2014-09-03 06:42:40.601459500 2014-09-03 06:42:40,596 ERROR [TP-Processor127] [extra.jira.util.JiraUtil] checkForErrors Received HTTP 413 from server. Error message: Request Entity Too Large
2014-09-03 06:42:40.601462500  -- url: /wiki/display/KEY/My+Page | page: 1234567 | userName: myname | action: viewpage
{code}
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro returns "Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error"

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate*
# Create an XLS/XLSX document
# Set a custom thousand separator ([instructions|http://office.microsoft.com/en-001/excel-help/change-the-character-used-to-separate-thousands-or-decimals-HP001230245.aspx]) to different character (for example a single quote ( ' ) )
# Put a number '1000000' and Format the cell to have thousands separator
# Save the file
# Create a new Confluence page
# Attach the XLSX file and embed the Excel file
fields.summary: Excel Custom Thousand Separator Is Not Reflected When Embedding Excel File

thanks.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34772].
  {panel}

Word has a useful basic shapes and call out feature set where you can quickly draw coloured outlined circles and other shapes around important parts of a document and to clarify points with a call out text box and arrow.

It would be great if Confluence could have such a feature under the edit menu to highlight words, paragraphs and parts of embedded images with coloured out lines, of various shapes and sizes and call out text boxes.

One example would be when creating work instructions using screen shots and having a convenient way to highlight parts of a screenshot without having to go to Word to make the changes.

I know this starts to go towards a drawing package but I think even if it was kept basic it would be extremely useful.
fields.summary: Call out and Highlight Shapes for Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34771].
  {panel}

Embedded graphics in confluence have a handy resize feature where images can be displayed at a smaller size and then clicked on by the user to reveal the full image. This is perfect for saving screen real estate or when trying to keep the flow of a document from being interrupted by large images.

1) It would be good to have  a "apply to all images on page" tick box  when selecting a display size while in page edit mode.

fields.description:
*Scenario:*

- You start editing a page, and the server gets restarted. You have a persistent auth cookie ("remember me box checked on login") so your periodical heartbeat keeps working, but your XSRF token (tied to the session ID) has expired.
- If you are editing the page and hit "preview", the REST resource will respond with 403 (it does the anti forgery check). Also the periodical "save draft" will fail for the same reason so you get stuck in a situation where the only way out is try saving the page (the action will fail but a new xsrf token will be issued), which sucks.

*How to reproduce it easily:*

- Create a blog post or page
- Go to Chrome tools and change the xsrf token value by editing manually all the  
{code}
<meta name="ajs-atl-token" content="49a13104891a700a54406dfdf3437cb4275dc167">
<meta id="atlassian-token" name="atlassian-token" content="49a13104891a700a54406dfdf3437cb4275dc167">
<input type="hidden" name="atl_token" value="49a13104891a700a54406dfdf3437cb4275dc167">
{code}
 (not sure why we have so many different meta tags containing the xsrf, this ticket may a good opportunity to find out)
- Now hit preview and you will get something similar to the screenshot attached.

*Potential fixes/improvements:*

- Better notifications. We can check the status code of the response error. If it is 403, we can tell the user what's going on.
- Or better, we can reissue a new XSRF token from the server, and resubmit. Or get a new XSRF and ask the user to resubmit.
- As mentioned above, this needs to be addressed in both preview and save draft.
- A similar solution can be applied to fix CONFDEV-24392 (XSRF token expiration when hitting save)
fields.summary: Better handle XSRF token expiration when editing

fields.description:
Confluence 5.5 upgrade task include migrating user properties with the following SQL queries according to Confluence source code:

{code}
select p.entity_name, p.entity_key, u.user_key " +
                            "from OS_PROPERTYENTRY p left join user_mapping u " +
                            "on " + sqlSubstring("p.entity_name", OLD_ENTITY_NAME_PREFIX) + " = u.lower_username " +
                            "where entity_name like ? and entity_id=?{code}

The above SQL queries indicate that Confluence does not migrate users with upper case since OS_PROPERTYENTRY table use username as the identifier instead of lower username.

Since we do support username with uppercase for external users we should use {{user_name}} instead of {{lower_username}}.
fields.summary: "extractUserPropertyMigrations" Process Exclude Username with Uppercase

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Title and Alt Texts on image properties will not be saved if its contains certain special characters
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page, add an image
 # In the editor mode, select the image to show the image properties panel > select *Properties* > Title
 # Add the following:
 ** Title Text: test ?
 ** Alt Text: test ?
 !image-2019-08-01-17-52-02-714.png|thumbnail! 
 # Save the changes, and save the page.
 # Edit and check the image properties window

h3. Expected Results
* The texts are saved
* If there are offending characters, some form of warning should pop up.

h3. Actual Results
The texts are not saved, no warning appears.

h3. Notes
* The alt text is not lost while in the editor (i.e.you can see your text if you open the "properties" a second time).
*  Characters that will *show issue* 
** Title field:  '?' (question mark),'"' (double quote), ';' (semi colon)
** Alt field:    '/' (forward slash) , '':' (colon), '?' (question mark) ,'"' (double quote), ';' (semi colon)
* Characters that will *not show issue*:
** Title field:  '/' (forward slash) and ':' (colon)
** Alt field:  '.' (period) or a "'" (single quote)

h3.Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Title and Alt Text disappears silently on image properties when adding certain special characters

First time in Jira - apologies if I'm in the wrong place.

I think the 'Additional Instructions' field on the Destinations page in Delivery on A5 could confuse clients. A simple change - changing the text from 'Additional Instructions' to 'Additional Instructions to Adstream' - would make it foolproof. 

I had to check myself whether this fed through to the Broadcaster interface (and so was somewhere for clients to write instructions for the Broadcaster) or whether it only fed through to Adstream Traffic (and was intended for instructions only for them). 

If a client believes it feeds through to Broadcasters, we could get stuck if they enter an important instruction in good faith and we miss passing it on to the Broadcaster or flagging to the client that the Broadcaster won't see the comment  and they'll need to contact them themselves. 



Thanks,

Charlotte

fields.description:
*Bug Description*

Due to multiple reason explain [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-25426] Confluence set the value for {{attribute_name}} "com.atlassian.crowd.directory.sync.issynchronising" to "true" which made it think that it is still synchronising against its user directories even after restarting the instance.

This cause Confluence not to run the initial synchronisation during the start-up process and it won't be able to synchronise *automatically* afterwards.

*Finding*

In some cases, if Confluence synchronisation was incomplete users from the affected directory won't be able to log-in as the users are not synchronize yet. 

If this occurred to a Confluence instance that use Crowd SSO, user won't be able to log-in using its internal admin users to manually synchronise the Crowd directory.

*Recommendation*

Confluence should check the value of "com.atlassian.crowd.directory.sync.issynchronising" during restart process and set it to "false" automatically if it is set to "true" to resolve this issue

*Workaround*

# Shutdown Confluence
# Execute the following SQL query to the database and take note of the problematic directory ID 
#* {code:SQL}SELECT * FROM cwd_directory;{code}
# Execute the following SQL query to ensure that Confluence won't run the synchronization after restart
#* {code:SQL}UPDATE cwd_directory_attribute SET attribute_value = 'false' WHERE attribute_name='com.atlassian.crowd.directory.sync.issynchronising' AND directory_id = <from the previous query>;{code}
# Restart Confluence
fields.summary: Confluence Won't Synchronise Against its User Directories

fields.description:
It appears the way User Mentions are displayed is driven off of the "User Display Name Attribute" in the User Directory Configuration, which we have set to "displayName" in AD. Our displayName attribute is in the format of "Lastname, Firstname" which doesn't look very nice when doing user mentions. And at this point, we can't change the format of our AD attribute.

So I followed [this Atlassian article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=296094848] which describes how you can change your User Directory config to make Confluence instead use "givenname + sn" for displaying user's names (by putting in a bogus attribute). I did that, resync'd the directory with AD, and restarted Confluence and all the user's Profile pages now show a nice "Firstname Lastname" for their Full Name, which is great. But...

When I go to do a user mention with "@", they still show up and auto-complete using the old "Lastname, Firstname" format. How do we get User Mention's to reflect an LDAP user's new Full Name?

Note: If I create a LOCAL Confluence user, and change his 'Full Name' (and clear the User Properties cache), it's friendly name in the User Mention reflects the change correctly. Just doesn't seem to work with LDAP users.

I asked this on Answers, but haven't gotten an answer and I think it could be a bug. https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/329713/change-user-mention-display-name
fields.summary: Can't change user mention display values

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

1. Create a page "Page A"
2. Create a page "Page B" with a hyperlink to [Page A
3. Create a new version of Page B (just add random text)
4. Rename Page A to Page C
5. In the version history of Page B (or when restoring previous version) the link to Page A has been broken and replaced by a createpage link

This would result in a new page being created by the name Page A, instead of just hyperlinking to Page C.
fields.summary: Renaming a page creates broken links on previous versions of referring pages

fields.description:
Some images produced by scanners or TIFF graphics which are then converted to PDF will not render in Confluence.  

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-33763 looks like a duplicate of this issue.  However the difference is that the workaround does not work for some particular images, please see support case attached for example.
